page.title: 14Gamekeeping In Odell Woods
page.content: Tony Read is Lord Luke's gamekeeper, on the Odell Estate which covers 3,000 acres(800 acres of woodland). Up to last year Mr Read collected the pheasant eggs and sent them away to be hatched. Now he buys in 4,000 day old pheasants which he rears in pens. At 7 weeks old the birds are released into the woods. This ensures that there will be enough sport for Lord Luke and his guests. There are 'shoots' on the estate for 11 days during the season - October to January. Part of Mr Read's job is to destroy the vermin which will either attack the pheasants,or destroy the trees. Magpies,crows,stoats,weasels and hedgehogs (which suck the eggs) are more of a problem than poachers! Mr Read works from dawn to dusk, 7 days a week, and holidays in winter when the shooting season ends.
